definition: letter of congratulations/greeting card (e.g. for New Year)

sentences.english: He didn't know he was enrolled until he received a congratulatory letter from the school.
sentences.chinese: 到学校寄来的贺函，他才知道自己被录取了。

sentences.english: Your letter of congratulations gives me a great deal of pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 你的贺函带给我莫大的欢喜。

sentences.english: He received as many as a hundred letters of congratulation on that single day.
sentences.chinese: 在那一天之内他所收到的贺函多达一百封。

sentences.english: I am very happy to have received your message of greetings.
sentences.chinese: 接到你们的贺函，我十分高兴。

sentences.english: I am very happy and grateful to receive your message of greetings.
sentences.chinese: 接到你们的贺函，使我十分愉快和感谢。

definition: handsome high-powered businessman (a type of character in an eponymous genre of romantic fiction who typically has a soft spot for a girl of lower social status)
to lose one's spouse (through marriage failure or bereavement)
Yao Bin (1957-), PRC champion ice skater during early 1980s and more recently national skating coach
"Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)

pinyin: ai4 de5 si3 qu4 huo2 lai2

definition: to be successful in business/professional success
(phonetic character used in transliteration of foreign names)/Taiwan pr. [li4]/variant of 璃[li2]
workplace/workforce (of a nation or industry etc)/job market
mistress/the other woman (coll.)/grade 3 in elementary school
(Internet slang) guy who grew up in the countryside and gained a foothold in the city through hard work
